task.title: Publish an Analytics audience segment
task.shortdesc: Steps that describe how to publish an Analytics audience segment to Adobe Target and the Marketing Cloud, for audience marketing activities.

step.cmd: In marketing reports & analytics (or ad hoc analysis), create a segment.

entry.p: Publish to Marketing Cloud (for report suite name)

Enabling this option publishes this segment to the Marketing Cloud. You can use it for marketing activity in the Audience Library, Target, and audience management. The Title and Description fields are required for the segment to be published.

Publishing a segment to the Marketing Cloud from Analytics displays the audience in the
Marketing Cloud Audience Library. The title and audience segment definition is shared, but not actual data. When that audience is associated with an active campaign in Target, Analytics begins sending IDs for visitors that qualify for that audience. At that point, the audience name and corresponding data begins displaying in the Audience Library.
entry.note: In Analytics, you can edit or delete a published segment. If the segment is in use, a warning message is issued when you edit a segment. You cannot delete a published segment that is in use by Adobe Target.
entry.p:
For information about enabling Audience Services, see Implementing Audience Services (MMP) in the Marketing Cloud.
Audiences are not filtered based on the authentication state of a visitor. If a visitor can browse your site in un-authenticated and authenticated states, actions that occur when a visitor is un-authenticated can still cause a visitor to be included in an audience. Please review to understand the full privacy implications of audience sharing. xref

step.cmd: Access Adobe Target, then navigate to the Segment list.
On the Segment page, click Import Marketing Cloud Audiences

stepresult.p: This option displays the Analytics segment for use in activities.
